title: 108_s1021
content: The "Summer Food Service Program Improvement Act of 2003" amends the definition of areas with poor economic conditions and includes a prospective repeal with an effective date of October 1, 2005. SEC. 3. PAYMENTS. Amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act regarding payments for operating expenses and administrative costs to service institutions. Also includes a conforming amendment to the Act. SEC. 4. STARTUP GRANTS FOR SUMMER FOOD SERVICE PROGRAMS. Section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to provide startup grants for summer food service programs. Eligible service institutions can receive grants to initiate program sites, with a total amount of $5,000,000 for each fiscal year. Grants are provided on a competitive basis to 10 States to assist in operating the summer food service program. The subsection provides supplementary funds for eligible service institutions to initiate summer food service programs, requiring States to submit a plan for program sites. States with preferences are given grants to start summer food service programs. The Secretary gives preference to States with low summer food program participation relative to the school year. Unused funds must be reallocated promptly. States can apply annually for grants, and each State must prioritize assistance within its borders. The State must prioritize assistance for summer food service programs based on need. Funds from State and local sources for the program cannot be reduced due to grants received. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act and its amendments take effect on October 1, 2003.
